remarks: The value of the internal direct product operation, which is a function mapping the (infinite, but finitely supported) cartesian product of subgroups (which mutually commute and have trivial intersections) to its (group) sum .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Apr-2016.)  (Revised by AV, 11-Jul-2019.)
statement:
dprdval.0 $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
dprdval.w $e |- W = { h e. X_ i e. I ( S ` i ) | h finSupp .0. } $.
dprdval $p |- ( ( G dom DProd S /\ dom S = I ) -> ( G DProd S ) = ran ( f e. W |-> ( G gsum f ) ) ) $.
$d G f h i $.
$d I f h i $.
$d S f h i $.
$d f h i $.
